text: Carlo Diotallevi (1607 – March 1652) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Strongoli (1639–1652). (in Latin) ==Biography== Carlo Diotallevi was born in Rimini, Italy. On 2 May 1639, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Urban VIII as Bishop of Strongoli. On 22 May 1639, he was consecrated bishop by Alessandro Cesarini (iuniore), Cardinal-Deacon of Sant'Eustachio, with Lelio Falconieri, Titular Archbishop of Thebae, and Giovanni Battista Altieri, Bishop Emeritus of Camerino, serving as co-consecrators. He served as Bishop of Strongoli until his death in March 1652. == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Urban VIII Category:1607 births Category:1652 deaths
title: Carlo Diotallevi
